alert.note: Alert for Monterey; San Benito; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 27 at 12:11PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Monterey and San Benito. In northern California, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 315 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1211 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salinas, Watsonville, Seaside, Monterey, Marina, Big Sur Village, Pacific Grove, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Carmel Valley Village, Spreckels, Boronda, San Clemente Dam, Castroville, Chualar, Cachagua Near The Los Padres Dam, Prunedale, Moss Landing, Del Monte Forest, Pico Blanco Campground and Andrew Molera State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

area.areaDesc: Monterey; San Benito; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
